alert.note: Alert for Clay; Nicholas; Pocahontas; Webster (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 11 at 9:10AM EDT until August 11 at 11:00AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM EDT THIS MORNING FOR CENTRAL CLAY, SOUTHWESTERN POCAHONTAS, SOUTHWESTERN WEBSTER AND CENTRAL NICHOLAS COUNTIES... At 910 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated between 2 and 3 inches of rain had fallen over the past few hours. While the heavy rain has since ended, runoff will continue to result in flash flooding of creeks and streams. There are reports of small creeks out of their banks in and around Craigsville. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar, automated gages, and public reports. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Clay, Camden-On-gauley, Craigsville, Cowen, Muddlety, Widen, and Ivydale. This includes the following streams and drainages... Cherry Run, Rockcamp Run, Hickory Fork, Sycamore Creek, Big Beaver Creek, Buckhorn Fork, Laurel Creek, Turkey Creek, and Poplar Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.
